img.alt: Elder Grove School is closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We miss you. Please reach out to help@eldergroveschool.org if you need anything.

div.div: Welcome to the Elder Grove School website. We hope you are able to find what is important to you. Enjoy your visit to our website!

span.p: It is hard to believe we are only3+ months away from the 2020-2021 School Year!!! Here is the school calendar for the upcoming year!

Parent Letter Regarding Continued School Closure

span.p: Please take a moment to read the letter from the Administration regarding the remainder of the school year. They have answered many of the questions that have been sent to them via Facebook and email.

a.title: Click to read more about: Parent Letter Regarding Continued School Closure

div.a: ...Read More about Parent Letter Regarding Continued School Closure

span.p: Tired of ebook reading? Elder Grove library is having an online bookfair April 27 - May 10. Books will be shipped to your home free with a $25 order! All proceeds will go to purchasing new books for the library.

a.title: Click to read more about: Online Bookfair

span.p: As most of you know, Kelsey Hunter, our elementary P.E. teacher is battling cancer. The PTO began Penny Wars as a new fundraiser this year, and in partnership with school staff, chose to donate all proceeds to Ms. Hunter.

Throughout the wars, the students had fun learning the art of sabotage and how different forms of money would affect their overall total. Our students competed by grade to see who could collect the most money with 5th grade winning collecting a total of $1,219.86.

With the amazing support and contributions from our great community we were able to raise $6,316.40 for Ms. Hunter! Thank you so much for your continued support in making The Grove the heart of our community.

a.title: Click to read more about: Penny Wars Helps Ms. Hunter

div.a: ...Read More about Penny Wars Helps Ms. Hunter

a.title: Elder Grove School District #8 CMS Login

div.p: The District is committed to ensuring accessibility of its website for students, parents, and members of the community with disabilities. All pages on the District's website will conform to the W3C WAI's Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AA conformance, or updated equivalents. Under District developed administrative procedures, students, parents, and members of the public may present a complaint regarding a violation of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Section 504 related to the accessibility of any official District web presence which is developed by, maintained by, or offered through the District or third-party vendors and open sources.
